segment.source: Windows Setup Automation Overview
segment.target: Windows Setup Automation Overview

segment.source: Windows Setup Automation Overview
segment.target: Windows Setup Automation Overview

segment.source: Windows Setup Automation Overview
segment.target: Windows Setup Automation Overview

segment.source: You can use a Windows Setup unattended answer file to modify system and control panel settings while installing Windows, or while updating an existing Windows image.
segment.target: You can use a Windows Setup unattended answer file to modify system and control panel settings while installing Windows, or while updating an existing Windows image.

segment.source: [Use an Answer File] (#use-an-answer-file-while-installing-windows)
segment.target: [Use an Answer File] (#use-an-answer-file-while-installing-windows)

segment.source: [Modify an existing installation] (#modify-an-existing-installation)
segment.target: [Modify an existing installation] (#modify-an-existing-installation)

segment.source: [Implicit Answer File Search Order] (#implicit-answer-file-search-order)
segment.target: [Implicit Answer File Search Order] (#implicit-answer-file-search-order)

segment.source: [Sensitive Data in Answer Files] (#sensitive-data-in-answer-files)
segment.target: [Sensitive Data in Answer Files] (#sensitive-data-in-answer-files)

segment.source: [Implicit Answer File Search Examples] (#implicit-answer-file-search-examples)
segment.target: [Implicit Answer File Search Examples] (#implicit-answer-file-search-examples)

segment.source: Use an answer file while installing Windows
segment.target: Use an answer file while installing Windows

segment.source: You can automate Windows installation by using an answer file:
segment.target: You can automate Windows installation by using an answer file:

segment.source: Use a USB flash drive
segment.target: Use a USB flash drive

segment.source: Use a sample answer file or create your own with Windows System Image Manager (Windows SIM).
segment.target: Use a sample answer file or create your own with Windows System Image Manager (Windows SIM).

segment.source: Save the file as Autounattend.xml on the root of a USB flash drive.
segment.target: Save the file as Autounattend.xml on the root of a USB flash drive.

segment.source: On a new PC, put in the Windows product DVD and the USB flash drive, and then boot the PC.
segment.target: On a new PC, put in the Windows product DVD and the USB flash drive, and then boot the PC.

segment.source: When no other answer file is selected, Windows Setup searches for this file.
segment.target: When no other answer file is selected, Windows Setup searches for this file.

segment.source: Select an answer file
segment.target: Select an answer file

segment.source: You can select a specific answer file during installation by booting to the Windows Preinstallation Environment, and using the setup.exe command with the /unattend:filename option.
segment.target: You can select a specific answer file during installation by booting to the Windows Preinstallation Environment, and using the setup.exe command with the /unattend:filename option.

segment.source: For more information, see WinPE: Create USB Bootable drive.
segment.target: For more information, see WinPE: Create USB Bootable drive.

segment.source: For sample answer files and a list of settings used to automate installation, see Automate Windows Setup.
segment.target: For sample answer files and a list of settings used to automate installation, see Automate Windows Setup.

segment.source: Modify an existing installation
segment.target: Modify an existing installation

segment.source: Because reboots are required during Setup, a copy of the answer file is cached to the %WINDIR%Panther directory of the Windows installation.
segment.target: Because reboots are required during Setup, a copy of the answer file is cached to the %WINDIR%Panther directory of the Windows installation.

segment.source: You can modify this file to do any of the following:
segment.target: You can modify this file to do any of the following:

segment.source: Update system and control panel settings without booting the image.
segment.target: Update system and control panel settings without booting the image.

segment.source: Update an image by preparing the PC to boot to audit mode (see Microsoft-Windows-DeploymentResealMode).
segment.target: Update an image by preparing the PC to boot to audit mode (see Microsoft-Windows-DeploymentResealMode).

segment.source: Update the order in which drivers or packages are installed.
segment.target: Update the order in which drivers or packages are installed.

segment.source: (Packages with dependencies may require installation in a certain order.)
segment.target: (Packages with dependencies may require installation in a certain order.)

segment.source: Replace the answer file in an offline image
segment.target: Replace the answer file in an offline image

segment.source: Create a custom answer file in Windows System Image Manager (Windows SIM).
segment.target: Create a custom answer file in Windows System Image Manager (Windows SIM).

segment.source: Open an elevated command prompt.
segment.target: Open an elevated command prompt.

segment.source: Mount the Windows image.
segment.target: Mount the Windows image.

segment.source: Modify or replace the file: WindowsPantherunattend.xml in the mounted image.
segment.target: Modify or replace the file: WindowsPantherunattend.xml in the mounted image.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The answer file in the image may contain settings that have not yet been processed.
segment.target: The answer file in the image may contain settings that have not yet been processed.

segment.source: If you want these settings to get processed, edit the existing file rather than replacing it.
segment.target: If you want these settings to get processed, edit the existing file rather than replacing it.

segment.source: Unmount the image.
segment.target: Unmount the image.

segment.source: Test the image by deploying it to a new PC, without specifying an answer file.
segment.target: Test the image by deploying it to a new PC, without specifying an answer file.

segment.source: When Windows Setup runs, it finds and uses this answer file.
segment.target: When Windows Setup runs, it finds and uses this answer file.

segment.source: Implicit Answer File Search Order
segment.target: Implicit Answer File Search Order

segment.source: Windows Setup searches for answer files at the beginning of each configuration pass, including the initial installation and after applying and booting an image.
segment.target: Windows Setup searches for answer files at the beginning of each configuration pass, including the initial installation and after applying and booting an image.

segment.source: If an answer file is found, and it contains settings for the given configuration pass, it processes those settings.
segment.target: If an answer file is found, and it contains settings for the given configuration pass, it processes those settings.

segment.source: Windows Setup identifies and logs all available answer files, depending on the search order.
segment.target: Windows Setup identifies and logs all available answer files, depending on the search order.

segment.source: The answer file that has the highest precedence is used.
segment.target: The answer file that has the highest precedence is used.

segment.source: The answer file is validated and then cached to the computer.
segment.target: The answer file is validated and then cached to the computer.

segment.source: Valid answer files are cached to the $Windows.~BTSourcesPanther directory during the windowsPE and offlineServicing configuration passes.
segment.target: Valid answer files are cached to the $Windows.~BTSourcesPanther directory during the windowsPE and offlineServicing configuration passes.

segment.source: After the Windows installation is extracted to the hard disk, the answer file is cached to %WINDIR%panther.
segment.target: After the Windows installation is extracted to the hard disk, the answer file is cached to %WINDIR%panther.

segment.source: The following table shows the implicit answer file search order.
segment.target: The following table shows the implicit answer file search order.

segment.source: Search Order
segment.target: Search Order

segment.source: Location
segment.target: Location

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Registry
segment.target: Registry

segment.source: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\Setup\UnattendFile
segment.target: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\Setup\UnattendFile

segment.source: Specifies a pointer in the registry to an answer file.
segment.target: Specifies a pointer in the registry to an answer file.

segment.source: The answer file is not required to be named Unattend.xml.
segment.target: The answer file is not required to be named Unattend.xml.

segment.source: %WINDIR%\Panther\Unattend
segment.target: %WINDIR%\Panther\Unattend

segment.source: The name of the answer file must be Unattend.xml or Autounattend.xml.
segment.target: The name of the answer file must be Unattend.xml or Autounattend.xml.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Windows Setup searches this directory only on downlevel installations.
segment.target: Windows Setup searches this directory only on downlevel installations.

segment.source: If Windows Setup starts from Windows PE, the %WINDIR%\Panther\Unattend directory is not searched.
segment.target: If Windows Setup starts from Windows PE, the %WINDIR%\Panther\Unattend directory is not searched.

segment.source: %WINDIR%\Panther
segment.target: %WINDIR%\Panther

segment.source: Windows Setup caches answer files to this location for use in subsequent stages of installation.
segment.target: Windows Setup caches answer files to this location for use in subsequent stages of installation.

segment.source: For example, when a computer reboots, Setup can continue to apply the settings in an answer file.
segment.target: For example, when a computer reboots, Setup can continue to apply the settings in an answer file.

segment.source: If you explicitly specify an answer file by using Windows Setup or Sysprep, the answer file cached to this directory is overwritten with the explicitly specified answer file.
segment.target: If you explicitly specify an answer file by using Windows Setup or Sysprep, the answer file cached to this directory is overwritten with the explicitly specified answer file.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Do not use, modify, or overwrite the answer file in this directory.
segment.target: Do not use, modify, or overwrite the answer file in this directory.

segment.source: The answer file in this directory is annotated by Windows Setup during installation.
segment.target: The answer file in this directory is annotated by Windows Setup during installation.

segment.source: This answer file cannot be reused in Windows SIM or any other Windows installations.
segment.target: This answer file cannot be reused in Windows SIM or any other Windows installations.

segment.source: Removable read/write media in order of drive letter, at the root of the drive.
segment.target: Removable read/write media in order of drive letter, at the root of the drive.

segment.source: Removable read/write media in order of drive letter, at the root of the drive.
segment.target: Removable read/write media in order of drive letter, at the root of the drive.

segment.source: The name of the answer file must be Unattend.xml or Autounattend.xml, and the answer file must be located at the root of the drive.
segment.target: The name of the answer file must be Unattend.xml or Autounattend.xml, and the answer file must be located at the root of the drive.

segment.source: Removable read-only media in order of drive letter, at the root of the drive.
segment.target: Removable read-only media in order of drive letter, at the root of the drive.

segment.source: Removable read-only media in order of drive letter, at the root of the drive.
segment.target: Removable read-only media in order of drive letter, at the root of the drive.

segment.source: The name of the answer file must be Unattend.xml or Autounattend.xml, and must be located at the root of the drive.
segment.target: The name of the answer file must be Unattend.xml or Autounattend.xml, and must be located at the root of the drive.

segment.source: windowsPE and offlineServicing configuration passes:
segment.target: windowsPE and offlineServicing configuration passes:

segment.source: \Sources directory in a Windows distribution
segment.target: \Sources directory in a Windows distribution

segment.source: All other passes:
segment.target: All other passes:

segment.source: %WINDIR%\System32\Sysprep
segment.target: %WINDIR%\System32\Sysprep

segment.source: In the windowsPE and offlineServicing configuration passes, the name of the answer file must be Autounattend.xml.
segment.target: In the windowsPE and offlineServicing configuration passes, the name of the answer file must be Autounattend.xml.

segment.source: For all other configuration passes, the file name must be Unattend.xml.
segment.target: For all other configuration passes, the file name must be Unattend.xml.

segment.source: %SYSTEMDRIVE%
segment.target: %SYSTEMDRIVE%

segment.source: The answer file name must be Unattend.xml or Autounattend.xml
segment.target: The answer file name must be Unattend.xml or Autounattend.xml

segment.source: Drive from where Windows Setup (setup.exe) is running, at the root of the drive.
segment.target: Drive from where Windows Setup (setup.exe) is running, at the root of the drive.

segment.source: The name of the answer file must be Unattend.xml or Autounattend.xml, and must be located at the root of the Windows Setup folder path.
segment.target: The name of the answer file must be Unattend.xml or Autounattend.xml, and must be located at the root of the Windows Setup folder path.

segment.source: Sensitive Data in Answer Files
segment.target: Sensitive Data in Answer Files

segment.source: Setup removes sensitive data in the cached answer file at the end of each configuration pass.
segment.target: Setup removes sensitive data in the cached answer file at the end of each configuration pass.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Because answer files are cached to the computer during Windows Setup, your answer files will persist on the computer between reboots.
segment.target: Because answer files are cached to the computer during Windows Setup, your answer files will persist on the computer between reboots.

segment.source: Before you deliver the computer to a customer, you must delete the cached answer file in the %WINDIR%panther directory.
segment.target: Before you deliver the computer to a customer, you must delete the cached answer file in the %WINDIR%panther directory.

segment.source: There might be potential security issues if you include domain passwords, product keys, or other sensitive data in your answer file.
segment.target: There might be potential security issues if you include domain passwords, product keys, or other sensitive data in your answer file.

segment.source: However, if you have unprocessed settings in the oobeSystem configuration pass that you intend to run when an end user starts the computer, consider deleting the sections of the answer file that have already been processed.
segment.target: However, if you have unprocessed settings in the oobeSystem configuration pass that you intend to run when an end user starts the computer, consider deleting the sections of the answer file that have already been processed.

segment.source: One option when you run the sysprep /oobe command might be to use a separate answer file that only contains settings in the oobeSystem configuration pass.
segment.target: One option when you run the sysprep /oobe command might be to use a separate answer file that only contains settings in the oobeSystem configuration pass.

segment.source: However, if an answer file is embedded in a higher precedence location than the cached answer file, then the cached answer may be overwritten at the beginning of each subsequent configuration pass, if the embedded answer file matches the implicit search criteria.
segment.target: However, if an answer file is embedded in a higher precedence location than the cached answer file, then the cached answer may be overwritten at the beginning of each subsequent configuration pass, if the embedded answer file matches the implicit search criteria.

segment.source: For example, if an answer file is embedded at %WINDIR%PantherUnattendUnattend.xml, the embedded answer file will replace the cached answer file at the beginning of each configuration pass.
segment.target: For example, if an answer file is embedded at %WINDIR%PantherUnattendUnattend.xml, the embedded answer file will replace the cached answer file at the beginning of each configuration pass.

segment.source: For example, if the embedded answer file specifies both the specialize and oobeSystem configuration passes, then the embedded answer file is discovered for the specialize configuration pass, cached, processed, and sensitive data is cleared.
segment.target: For example, if the embedded answer file specifies both the specialize and oobeSystem configuration passes, then the embedded answer file is discovered for the specialize configuration pass, cached, processed, and sensitive data is cleared.

segment.source: The embedded answer file is discovered again during the oobeSystem configuration pass and cached again.
segment.target: The embedded answer file is discovered again during the oobeSystem configuration pass and cached again.

segment.source: As a result, the sensitive data for the specialize configuration pass is no longer cleared.
segment.target: As a result, the sensitive data for the specialize configuration pass is no longer cleared.

segment.source: Sensitive data for previously processed configuration passes will not be cleared again.
segment.target: Sensitive data for previously processed configuration passes will not be cleared again.

segment.source: Unless the cached answer file must be overridden, we recommend that answer files be embedded at a location that has a lower precedence.
segment.target: Unless the cached answer file must be overridden, we recommend that answer files be embedded at a location that has a lower precedence.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Because answer files are cached to the computer during Windows Setup, your answer files will persist on the computer between reboots.
segment.target: Because answer files are cached to the computer during Windows Setup, your answer files will persist on the computer between reboots.

segment.source: Before you deliver the computer to a customer, you must delete the cached answer file in the %WINDIR%panther directory.
segment.target: Before you deliver the computer to a customer, you must delete the cached answer file in the %WINDIR%panther directory.

segment.source: There might be potential security issues if you include domain passwords, product keys, or other sensitive data in your answer file.
segment.target: There might be potential security issues if you include domain passwords, product keys, or other sensitive data in your answer file.

segment.source: However, if you have unprocessed settings in the oobeSystem configuration pass that you intend to run when an end user starts the computer, consider deleting the sections of the answer file that have already been processed.
segment.target: However, if you have unprocessed settings in the oobeSystem configuration pass that you intend to run when an end user starts the computer, consider deleting the sections of the answer file that have already been processed.

segment.source: One option when you run the sysprep /oobe command might be to use a separate answer file that only contains settings in the oobeSystem configuration pass.
segment.target: One option when you run the sysprep /oobe command might be to use a separate answer file that only contains settings in the oobeSystem configuration pass.

segment.source: You can add a command to the Setupcomplete.cmd command script that deletes any cached or embedded answer files on the computer.
segment.target: You can add a command to the Setupcomplete.cmd command script that deletes any cached or embedded answer files on the computer.

segment.source: For more information, see Add a Custom Script to Windows Setup.
segment.target: For more information, see Add a Custom Script to Windows Setup.

segment.source: Windows Setup Annotates Configuration Passes in an Answer File
segment.target: Windows Setup Annotates Configuration Passes in an Answer File

segment.source: After a configuration pass is processed, Windows Setup annotates the cached answer file to indicate that the pass has been processed.
segment.target: After a configuration pass is processed, Windows Setup annotates the cached answer file to indicate that the pass has been processed.

segment.source: If the configuration pass is run again and the cached answer file has not been replaced or updated in the interim, the answer file settings are not processed again.
segment.target: If the configuration pass is run again and the cached answer file has not been replaced or updated in the interim, the answer file settings are not processed again.

segment.source: Instead, Windows Setup will search for implicit Unattend.xml files that are at a lower precedence location than the cached Unattend.xml file.
segment.target: Instead, Windows Setup will search for implicit Unattend.xml files that are at a lower precedence location than the cached Unattend.xml file.

segment.source: For example, you can install Windows with an answer file that contains Microsoft-Windows-Deployment/RunSynchronous commands in the specialize configuration pass.
segment.target: For example, you can install Windows with an answer file that contains Microsoft-Windows-Deployment/RunSynchronous commands in the specialize configuration pass.

segment.source: During installation, the specialize configuration pass runs and the RunSynchronous commands execute.
segment.target: During installation, the specialize configuration pass runs and the RunSynchronous commands execute.

segment.source: After installation, run the sysprep command with the /generalize option.
segment.target: After installation, run the sysprep command with the /generalize option.

segment.source: If there is no answer file in a higher precedence than the cached answer file or an answer file was not explicitly passed to the Sysprep tool, Setup runs the specialize configuration pass the next time that the computer boots.
segment.target: If there is no answer file in a higher precedence than the cached answer file or an answer file was not explicitly passed to the Sysprep tool, Setup runs the specialize configuration pass the next time that the computer boots.

segment.source: Because the cached answer file contains an annotation that the settings for that configuration pass were already applied, the RunSynchronous commands do not execute.
segment.target: Because the cached answer file contains an annotation that the settings for that configuration pass were already applied, the RunSynchronous commands do not execute.

segment.source: Implicit Answer File Search Examples
segment.target: Implicit Answer File Search Examples

segment.source: The following examples help describe the behavior of implicit answer file searches.
segment.target: The following examples help describe the behavior of implicit answer file searches.

segment.source: Answer Files Named Autounattend.xml are Automatically Discovered by Windows Setup
segment.target: Answer Files Named Autounattend.xml are Automatically Discovered by Windows Setup

segment.source: Create an answer file that is named Autounattend.xml that includes settings in the windowsPE configuration pass.
segment.target: Create an answer file that is named Autounattend.xml that includes settings in the windowsPE configuration pass.

segment.source: Copy Autounattend.xml to a removable media device.
segment.target: Copy Autounattend.xml to a removable media device.

segment.source: Configure the BIOS of your computer to boot from CD or DVD.
segment.target: Configure the BIOS of your computer to boot from CD or DVD.

segment.source: Boot the Windows product DVD.
segment.target: Boot the Windows product DVD.

segment.source: Insert the removable media device when Windows is booting.
segment.target: Insert the removable media device when Windows is booting.

segment.source: This example assumes that the removable media is assigned the drive letter D:.
segment.target: This example assumes that the removable media is assigned the drive letter D:.

segment.source: Windows Setup starts and automatically identifies Autounattend.xml as a valid answer file.
segment.target: Windows Setup starts and automatically identifies Autounattend.xml as a valid answer file.

segment.source: Because the answer file uses a valid file name (Autounattend.xml), is located in one of the valid search paths (the root of D), and includes valid settings for the current configuration pass (windowsPE), this answer file is used.
segment.target: Because the answer file uses a valid file name (Autounattend.xml), is located in one of the valid search paths (the root of D), and includes valid settings for the current configuration pass (windowsPE), this answer file is used.

segment.source: The answer file is cached to the computer.
segment.target: The answer file is cached to the computer.

segment.source: If there are no additional answer files discovered in later passes, the cached answer file is used throughout Windows Setup.
segment.target: If there are no additional answer files discovered in later passes, the cached answer file is used throughout Windows Setup.

segment.source: Answer Files are Discovered in Order of Precedence in Predefined Search Paths
segment.target: Answer Files are Discovered in Order of Precedence in Predefined Search Paths

segment.source: Install Windows with an answer file by using the steps in the previous scenario.
segment.target: Install Windows with an answer file by using the steps in the previous scenario.

segment.source: The answer file that is used to install Windows is cached to the system in the %WINDIR%Panther directory.
segment.target: The answer file that is used to install Windows is cached to the system in the %WINDIR%Panther directory.

segment.source: Copy an Unattend.xml file to the %WINDIR%System32Sysprep directory.
segment.target: Copy an Unattend.xml file to the %WINDIR%System32Sysprep directory.

segment.source: This answer file has settings in the generalize configuration pass.
segment.target: This answer file has settings in the generalize configuration pass.

segment.source: Run the sysprep command with the /generalize option to create a reference image.
segment.target: Run the sysprep command with the /generalize option to create a reference image.

segment.source: Because the %WINDIR%System32Sysprep directory is in the implicit search paths, the answer file copied to this directory is found.
segment.target: Because the %WINDIR%System32Sysprep directory is in the implicit search paths, the answer file copied to this directory is found.

segment.source: However, an answer file that was used to install Windows is still cached on the computer and contains settings for the generalize configuration pass.
segment.target: However, an answer file that was used to install Windows is still cached on the computer and contains settings for the generalize configuration pass.

segment.source: This cached answer file has a higher precedence than the one copied to the Sysprep directory.
segment.target: This cached answer file has a higher precedence than the one copied to the Sysprep directory.

segment.source: The cached answer file is used.
segment.target: The cached answer file is used.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The Sysprep tool can be run as a command-line tool or as a GUI tool.
segment.target: The Sysprep tool can be run as a command-line tool or as a GUI tool.

segment.source: If you run the Sysprep tool as a GUI tool, you can select the Generalize check box.
segment.target: If you run the Sysprep tool as a GUI tool, you can select the Generalize check box.

segment.source: To use the new answer file, you can copy it to a directory of a higher precedence than the cached answer file, or you can specify the answer file by using the /unattend option.
segment.target: To use the new answer file, you can copy it to a directory of a higher precedence than the cached answer file, or you can specify the answer file by using the /unattend option.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: Answer Files Must Include a Valid Configuration Pass
segment.target: Answer Files Must Include a Valid Configuration Pass

segment.source: Copy an Unattend.xml file to a removable media device.
segment.target: Copy an Unattend.xml file to a removable media device.

segment.source: The Unattend.xml file has settings only for the auditSystem and auditUser configuration passes.
segment.target: The Unattend.xml file has settings only for the auditSystem and auditUser configuration passes.

segment.source: On an installed Windows operating system, run the sysprep /generalize /oobe command.
segment.target: On an installed Windows operating system, run the sysprep /generalize /oobe command.

segment.source: Even though the answer file is available in one of the implicit search paths, the Unattend.xml file is ignored because it does not contain a valid pass for the generalize configuration pass.
segment.target: Even though the answer file is available in one of the implicit search paths, the Unattend.xml file is ignored because it does not contain a valid pass for the generalize configuration pass.
